Abu Dawud dan al-Baihaqi meriwayatkan dari Anas bin Malik bahwa dia berkata, "Setelah Allah menyuruh memilih kepada istri-istri Nabi., lalu mereka memilih supaya tetap berada di bawah naungan rumah tangga Nabi, maka Allah Taala pun membatasi Nabi untuk menambah istri-istrinya yang sembilan orang itu dengan tidak nikah lagi." Dan Allah adalah Maha Mengawasi segala sesuatu.

Allah mengizinkan Nabi Muhammad beristri lebih dari empat mengandung hikmah yang sangat tinggi karena pernikahan itu ditentukan oleh Allah Yang Maha Mengetahui dan Mahabijaksana. Di antara hikmah itu ialah:

1.Menyampaikan hukum khusus kaum wanita yang tidak diketahui kecuali oleh suami istri. Jika istri banyak, maka banyak pula hukum tentang perempuan yang dapat diperoleh. Diterima atau tidaknya riwayat yang berasal dari mereka sangat terpengaruh oleh banyaknya riwayat.

2.Kebutuhan terhadap pendukung yang kuat bagi dakwah pada permulaan Islam. Hubungan besan dan perkawinan secara tradisi pasti saling mendukung dan menolong.

3.Setiap orang Islam pasti ingin menjalin hubungan keluarga dengan Nabi saw, agar bebas masuk ke rumah Nabi saw. Bahkan, setiap muslim ingin dapat melayani Nabi.

4.Nabi saw membalas jasa orang yang membelanya dalam perjuangan Islam. Balasan yang sangat berharga adalah besanan dan menikahi keluarganya, seperti perkawinan Nabi dengan 'aisyah binti Abu Bakar dan Hafshah binti 'Umar.

5.Menghapus tradisi jahiliah dengan hukum yang lebih bermanfaat, seperti pernikahannya dengan Zainab. Sebetulnya Nabi tidak menginginkannya karena takut pada celaan orang, namun hal ini berguna untuk mempertahankan nasab dan kerabat.

6.Nabi mampu berbuat adil dan memberikan bimbingan kepada keluarganya, yang tidak dimiliki oleh orang lain.
text.53:
Pada ayat ini, Allah mengajarkan sopan santun atau etika terhadap rumah tangga Nabi saw. Allah melarang orang-orang yang beriman untuk memasuki rumah-rumah Nabi saw kecuali dengan izin beliau, untuk makan di rumahnya tanpa menunggu waktu masak makanannya. Pada masa Rasulullah pernah terjadi ada orang-orang yang menunggu waktu makannya. Lalu turun ayat ini yang melarang perbuatan tersebut. Bilamana Rasulullah mengundang beberapa orang sahabat ke rumahnya untuk menghadiri walimah, maka mereka dilarang memasuki rumah Nabi saw, kecuali bila mereka sudah mengetahui bahwa makanannya sudah siap dihidangkan.

Bila hidangan belum siap dan mereka masih sibuk menyiapkan hidangan, maka masuknya tamu itu akan mengganggu ketenangan keluarga Nabi saw. Hal ini juga mengganggu istri Nabi. saw yang sedang bekerja karena akan terlihat sebagian anggota tubuhnya yang tidak boleh dilihat oleh para tamu. Mereka dipersilakan masuk jika telah diundang. Apabila telah selesai makan, supaya segera keluar tanpa memperpanjang percakapan, karena hal itu benar-benar mengganggu Nabi saw, dan beliau sendiri merasa malu untuk menyuruh tamunya keluar. Akan tetapi, Allah tidak segan untuk menerangkan yang benar. 

Allah mengajarkan kesopanan di dalam rumah tangga supaya diperhatikan oleh seluruh tamu-tamu yang berkunjung ke rumah orang. Bilamana ada kepentingan untuk meminta atau meminjam suatu barang ke rumah istri-istri Nabi. saw, maka hendaklah permintaan itu dilakukan dari belakang tabir dan tidak berhadapan secara langsung. Hal yang demikian itu lebih menyucikan hati kedua belah pihak dan tidak pula menyakiti hati Rasulullah. Termasuk perbuatan yang menyakiti hati Rasulullah ialah menikahi istri-istrinya setelah beliau meninggal dunia. Larangan untuk menikahi bekas istri-istri Nabi. saw adalah larangan yang berlaku untuk selamanya karena perbuatan itu amat besar dosanya di sisi Allah. 

Nabi itu lebih utama bagi orang-orang mukmin dibandingkan diri mereka sendiri dan istri-istrinya adalah ibu-ibu mereka. (al-Ahzab/33: 6).

Imam al-Bukhari meriwayatkan dari Anas bahwa Umar bin Khaththab. pernah berkata, "Ada tiga pendapatku yang sesuai dengan wahyu yang diturunkan oleh Allah. Pertama, Aku berkata kepada Rasulullah, 'Wahai Rasulullah, alangkah baiknya bila engkau menjadikan maqam Ibrahim tempat salat, lalu Allah menurunkan ayat:

Dan jadikanlah maqam Ibrahim itu tempat salat. (al-Baqarah/2: 125)

Kedua, saya berkata, 'Wahai Rasulullah, sesungguhnya istri-istrimu sering didatangi tamu orang baik dan orang jahat, seandainya engkau membuat tabir untuk mereka tentu lebih baik, maka Allah menurunkan ayat hijab ini. Ketiga, saya pernah berkata kepada istri-istri Nabi. ketika mereka berselisih karena rasa cemburu terhadap Nabi, maka turunlah ayat ini:

Jika dia (Nabi) menceraikan kamu, boleh jadi Tuhan akan memberi ganti kepadanya dengan istri-istri yang lebih baik dari kamu. (at-Tahrim/66: 5)
text.54: Sebab turunnya ayat ini, sebagaimana diriwayatkan oleh Juwaibir dari Ibnu 'Abbas, bahwa ada seorang yang telah datang kepada sebagian istri-istri Nabi. saw yang menjadi anak pamannya, lalu bercakap-cakap dengan istri Nabi. secara langsung. Nabi saw menegur hal itu dengan sabdanya, "Janganlah engkau berbuat seperti ini pada kesempatan yang lain." Orang itu menjawab, "Wahai Rasulullah, ini adalah anak paman saya, dan saya tidak pernah mengatakan sesuatu yang mungkar, dan perempuan itu tidak boleh pula berkata yang tidak baik kepadaku." Nabi bersabda, "Kami telah mengetahui yang demikian itu. Tidak ada yang lebih cemburu daripada Allah, dan tidak ada seorang pun yang lebih cemburu daripada aku." Lalu laki-laki itu pergi sambil berkata, "Siapa yang dapat mencegahku untuk bercakap-cakap dengan anak pamanku; aku pasti akan menikahinya setelah Muhammad wafat." Maka turunlah ayat hijab ini, dan laki-laki itu merasa menyesal atas ucapan yang telah dikeluarkannya. Untuk menutupi kesalahan dan menebus dosanya, ia mengeluarkan kifarat dengan memerdekakan seorang hamba sahaya, memberi bekal untuk jihad dengan sepuluh ekor unta, dan naik haji dengan berjalan kaki.
text.55:
Tidak ada dosa atas istri-istri Nabi. untuk berjumpa tanpa memakai tabir dengan bapak-bapak mereka, baik bapak kandung maupun bapak sesusuan, anak-anak mereka, baik yang seketurunan maupun yang sesusuan, saudara-saudara mereka, atau anak saudara-saudaranya, baik laki-laki maupun perempuan, perempuan-perempuan muslimat yang dekat maupun yang jauh, atau hamba sahaya yang mereka miliki, baik laki-laki maupun perempuan. Adanya hijab di antara mereka itu akan menimbulkan banyak kesulitan karena mereka selalu berkhidmat dalam urusan rumah tangga. Tetapi, yang perlu diingat adalah agar selalu bertakwa kepada Allah untuk mengikuti perintah-Nya dan menjauhi larangan-Nya, karena Allah selalu menyaksikan segala sesuatu yang mereka perbuat.

Orang-orang yang disebutkan dalam ayat ini, yaitu ayah para istri Nabi., anak-anak mereka, saudara-saudara mereka, keponakan atau anak saudara mereka, baik saudara laki-laki maupun saudara perempuan, atau perempuan-perempuan lain dan juga budak mereka adalah mahram yaitu orang-orang yang tidak boleh menikahi mereka.

Adapun orang-orang selain tersebut di atas yaitu yang bukan mahram tidak boleh menemui istri-istri Nabi. tanpa hijab. Hal ini untuk menjaga kehormatan istri-istri Nabi. yang merupakan ummahatul mu'minin.
text.56:
Sesungguhnya Allah memberi rahmat kepada Nabi Muhammad, dan para malaikat memohonkan ampunan untuknya. Oleh karena itu, Allah menganjurkan kepada seluruh umat Islam supaya bersalawat pula untuk Nabi saw dan mengucapkan salam dengan penuh penghormatan kepadanya. 

Diriwayatkan dari Abu Sa'id al-Khudri bahwa ia bertanya, "Wahai Rasulullah, adapun pemberian salam kepadamu kami telah mengetahuinya, bagaimana kami harus membaca salawat?" Nabi menjawab, ucapkanlah: Allahumma shalli 'ala Muhammad wa 'ala ali Muhammad kama shallaita 'ala Ibrahim wa 'ala ali Ibrahim innaka hamid majid. Allahumma barik 'ala Muhammad wa 'ala ali Muhammad kama barakta 'ala Ibrahim wa 'ala ali Ibrahim innaka hamid majid. (Riwayat al-Bukhari, Ahmad, an-Nasa'i, Ibnu Majah, dan lainnya)

Diriwayatkan juga oleh 'Abdullah bin Abu thalhah dari ayahnya:

Bahwa Rasulullah datang pada suatu hari dan terlihat tanda-tanda kegembiraan di wajahnya. Lalu kami bertanya, "Kami telah melihat tanda-tanda kegembiraan di wajahmu." Nabi menjawab, "Memang, Jibril telah datang kepadaku dan berkata, 'Wahai Muhammad sesungguhnya Tuhanmu telah menyampaikan salam kepadamu dan berfirman, 'Tidakkah kamu merasa puas bahwa tidak ada seorang pun dari umatmu yang membaca salawat untukmu melainkan Aku membalasnya dengan sepuluh kali lipat. Dan tidak seorang pun yang menyampaikan salam kepadamu dari umatmu melainkan Aku membalas dengan salam sepuluh kali lipat."
text.57:
Pada ayat ini dijelaskan bahwa Allah mengutuk orang-orang yang menyakiti-Nya dengan melakukan perbuatan yang tidak diridai-Nya, seperti mengingkari perintah-Nya, yaitu ucapan orang-orang Nasrani bahwa Isa adalah putra Allah, atau seperti kaum musyrikin yang mengatakan bahwa malaikat adalah putri-putri Allah, atau menyekutukan-Nya. Allah juga mengutuk orang-orang yang menyakiti Rasul-Nya, seperti menuduh beliau seorang penyair, tukang sihir, atau seorang gila dan sebagainya. 

Kutukan Allah itu meliputi kutukan di dunia dan akhirat. Di dunia mereka dijauhkan dari rahmat Allah dan karunia-Nya, sehingga mereka bergelimang dalam kesesatan dan kemaksiatan. Di akhirat mereka dijerumuskan ke dalam api neraka yang merupakan seburuk-buruknya tempat kembali, dan Allah menyediakan bagi mereka azab yang sangat pedih dan menghinakan.
text.58:
Orang yang menyakiti para mukmin, baik laki-laki maupun perempuan, tanpa kesalahan yang mereka perbuat, dan hanya berdasarkan kepada fitnah dan tuduhan yang dibuat-buat, maka sungguh mereka itu telah melakukan dosa yang nyata. Menurut Ibnu 'Abbas, ayat ini diturunkan sehubungan dengan tuduhan 'Abdullah bin Ubay terhadap 'aisyah yang dikatakannya telah berbuat mesum dalam perjalanan pulang beserta Nabi Muhammad setelah memerangi Bani Mushthaliq, yang terkenal dengan hadits al-ifk. 

Dalam hadis Nabi saw dijelaskan:

Abu Hurairah meriwayatkan bahwa Rasulullah pernah ditanya tentang apa artinya bergunjing. Beliau menjawab, "Engkau menyebut-nyebut saudaramu dengan sesuatu yang dibencinya." Nabi ditanya lagi, "Bagaimana jika yang disebut itu memang benar atau suatu kenyataan?" Nabi menjawab, "Bila yang diucapkan itu benar, engkau telah mengumpat kepadanya, dan bila itu tidak benar maka engkau telah membuat kedustaan terhadapnya." (Riwayat Abu Dawud)
text.59: Allah memerintahkan kepada seluruh kaum muslimat terutama istri-istri Nabi. sendiri dan putri-putrinya agar mengulurkan jilbab ke seluruh tubuh mereka. Hal itu bertujuan agar mereka mudah dikenali dengan pakaiannya karena berbeda dengan jariyah (budak perempuan), sehingga mereka tidak diganggu oleh orang yang menyalahgunakan kesempatan. Seorang perempuan yang berpakaian sopan akan lebih mudah terhindar dari gangguan orang jahil. Sedangkan perempuan yang membuka auratnya di muka umum mudah dituduh atau dinilai sebagai perempuan yang kurang baik kepribadiannya. Bagi orang yang pada masa lalunya kurang hati-hati menutupi aurat, lalu mengadakan perbaikan, maka Allah Maha Pengampun lagi Maha Pengasih. Karena perbuatan yang menyakiti itu seringkali dilakukan oleh orang-orang munafik, maka pada ayat berikut ini Allah mengancam mereka dengan ancaman yang keras sekali.
text.60:
Jika orang-orang munafik dan orang-orang berpenyakit di hatinya, dan orang-orang yang menyebar berita bohong di Medinah itu tidak berhenti mendustakan Allah, menyakiti Rasul-Nya, dan kaum mukminin, niscaya Allah memerintahkan Nabi-Nya untuk memerangi mereka sehingga tidak akan dapat lagi untuk hidup lebih lama di Medinah bertetangga dengan Nabi saw. Mereka yang diancam akan diperangi dan dimusnahkan oleh Nabi itu adalah tiga golongan manusia:

1.Orang-orang munafik yang selalu menentang Allah secara tersembunyi.

2.Orang-orang berpenyakit di dalam hatinya, seperti dengki dan dendam yang selalu menyakiti orang mukmin seperti mengganggu para perempuan.

3.Orang-orang yang menyiarkan kabar bohong di Medinah sehingga menyakiti Nabi saw, dengan ucapan mereka bahwa Nabi Muhammad saw akan dikalahkan dan diusir dari Medinah dan sebagainya.
text.61: Ketiga golongan itu dilaknat di mana saja mereka berada, karena sikapnya yang selalu bermusuhan dan merugikan agama dan negara, mereka selalu dikejar-kejar untuk ditangkap dan dibunuh. Nasib orang yang seperti itu telah pula dialami oleh orang-orang sebelumnya karena begitulah sunah Allah.
text.62: Dengan demikian, sunah Allah yang telah berlaku atas orang-orang yang terdahulu sebelum diutusnya Nabi Muhammad saw akan berlaku pula bagi generasi yang datang kemudian. Hal itu tidak mungkin berubah dan pasti berlaku.
text.63: Banyak manusia bertanya kepada Nabi Muhammad tentang kapan datangnya hari Kiamat. Orang-orang musyrik menanyakan tentang kiamat tersebut secara mengejek dan mencemooh, serta menantang supaya hari Kiamat segera didatangkan. Orang-orang munafik menanyakan tentang hari Kiamat karena terdorong oleh anggapan bahwa Nabi saw akan menjawab seperti yang mereka perkirakan. Adapun orang-orang Yahudi bertanya dengan maksud menguji kebenaran Nabi saw, apakah jawabannya akan sama atau tidak dengan yang tercantum dalam kitab Taurat, bahwa soal hari Kiamat itu sesungguhnya berada di tangan Allah.
text.64:
Kemudian Allah menerangkan bahwa yang mengetahui kapan terjadinya hari Kiamat hanya Allah. Mungkin saja waktu datangnya hari Kiamat sudah dekat, karena setiap yang akan datang memang selalu mendekat dan mungkin dekat. Pepatah Arab mengatakan: 

"Setiap yang akan datang adalah dekat."

Kemudian Allah akan melaknat dan menjauhkan orang-orang kafir dari kebaikan dan rahmat-Nya. Allah juga menyediakan bagi mereka neraka Sa'ir.
text.65: Mereka kekal di dalam neraka selama-lamanya, dan tidak menemukan seorang pun yang dapat melindungi mereka dari azab Allah. Mereka juga tidak mendapatkan seorang penolong yang dapat menyelamatkan dari siksaan-Nya.
text.66: Mereka tidak memperoleh pelindung dan penolong seorang pun ketika mereka dibolak-balikkan di dalam neraka. Dengan penuh penyesalan mereka berkata, "Alangkah bahagianya seandainya kami dahulu di dunia taat kepada Allah dan taat pula kepada Muhammad utusan-Nya."
text.67: Mereka berkata dengan penuh perasaan mendongkol karena tertipu oleh para pemimpin dan pembesar mereka di dunia, "Ya Tuhan kami, sesungguhnya kami di dunia telah mengikuti pemimpin dan pembesar kami, lalu mereka menyesatkan kami dari jalan yang benar."
text.68:
Mereka dengan perasaan dendam terhadap orang-orang yang telah menyesatkan itu berkata, "Ya Tuhan kami, berikanlah kepada mereka azab dua kali lipat, pertama karena mereka telah tersesat, dan keduanya telah pula menyesatkan orang lain, dan kutuklah mereka dengan kutukan yang sangat besar." Keluhan mereka itu diperkuat dengan ayat lain seperti pada firman Allah:

Dan (ingatlah) pada hari (ketika) orang-orang zalim menggigit dua jarinya, (menyesali perbuatannya) seraya berkata, "Wahai! Sekiranya (dulu) aku mengambil jalan bersama Rasul. Wahai, celaka aku! Sekiranya (dulu) aku tidak menjadikan si fulan itu teman akrab(ku), sungguh, dia telah menyesatkan aku dari peringatan (Al-Qur'an) ketika (Al-Qur'an) itu telah datang kepadaku. Dan setan memang pengkhianat manusia." (al-Furqan/25: 27-29)
text.69:
Allah melarang kaum mukminin agar tidak berlaku seperti segolongan Bani Israil yang menyakiti Nabi Musa. Allah membersihkan beliau dari tuduhan-tuduhan yang mereka lontarkan kepadanya. Beliau adalah seorang yang mempunyai kedudukan yang sangat terhormat di sisi Allah. Di dalam ayat ini tidak disebutkan bagaimana caranya mereka menyakiti Nabi Musa itu. 

Dalam suatu riwayat tentang meninggalnya Harun, seperti diriwayatkan Ibnu Jarir ath-thabari dari Ibnu 'Abbas dari 'Ali bin Abi Talib bahwa beliau berkata, "Ketika Nabi Musa dan Harun naik ke gunung, Nabi Harun kemudian wafat. Orang-orang Bani Israil lalu marah kepada Nabi Musa, 'Kamu telah membunuh Harun, padahal beliau orang yang lebih kami sukai daripada engkau."

Dalam sebuah hadis, Rasulullah bersabda:

Diriwayatkan dari Ibnu Mas'ud bahwa Rasulullah saw pada suatu hari membagi-bagikan harta ganimah kepada sahabatnya, lalu ada seorang laki-laki dari kaum Anshar berkata bahwa pembagian itu tidak dimaksud untuk memperoleh keridaan Allah. Mendengar ucapan itu, Nabi saw tersinggung sampai merah wajahnya seraya berkata, "Semoga Allah merahmati Musa yang pernah disakiti orang lebih dari ini, tetapi beliau tetap berlaku sabar." (Riwayat al-Bukhari dan Muslim)
text.70: Pada ayat ini, Allah memerintahkan kepada orang-orang beriman supaya tetap bertakwa kepada-Nya. Allah juga memerintahkan orang-orang beriman untuk selalu berkata yang benar, selaras antara yang diniatkan dan yang diucapkan, karena seluruh kata yang diucapkan dicatat oleh malaikat Raqib dan 'Atid, dan harus dipertanggungjawabkan di hadapan Allah. Firman Allah:
text.71: Bila mereka tetap memelihara keimanan dan ketakwaan dan selalu mengatakan kebenaran, pasti Allah akan memperbaiki perbuatan dan mengampuni dosa-dosa mereka. Siapa yang menginginkan kebahagiaan di dunia dan akhirat, maka jalan yang harus ditempuh hanyalah satu, yaitu menaati Allah dan Rasul-Nya. Dengan demikian, mereka akan mendapatkan kebahagiaan yang besar di dunia dan akhirat.
text.72:
Sesungguhnya Allah telah menawarkan tugas-tugas keagamaan kepada langit, bumi, dan gunung-gunung. Karena ketiganya tidak mempunyai persiapan untuk menerima amanat yang berat itu, maka semuanya enggan untuk memikul amanat yang ditawarkan Allah itu. 

Kemudian amanat untuk melaksanakan tugas-tugas keagamaan itu ditawarkan kepada manusia dan mereka menerimanya dengan konsekuensi barang siapa yang melaksanakan itu akan diberi pahala dan dimasukkan ke dalam surga. Sebaliknya, barang siapa yang mengkhianatinya akan disiksa dan dimasukkan ke dalam api neraka. Walaupun bentuk badannya lebih kecil dibandingkan dengan ketiga makhluk yang lain (langit, bumi, dan gunung-gunung), manusia berani menerima amanat tersebut karena manusia mempunyai potensi. Tetapi, karena pada diri manusia terdapat ambisi dan syahwat yang sering mengelabui mata dan menutup pandangan hatinya, Allah menyifatinya dengan amat zalim dan bodoh karena kurang memikirkan akibat-akibat dari penerimaan amanat itu.
text.73: Allah lalu menerangkan bahwa akibat dari penerimaan amanat ini ialah Dia mengazab orang-orang munafik dan orang-orang musyrik, baik laki-laki maupun perempuan, bila mereka mengabaikan pelaksanaan amanat yang telah dipikulnya. Allah akan menerima tobat orang-orang mukmin laki-laki dan perempuan yang taat melaksanakan amanat itu. Sesungguhnya Allah Maha Pengampun lagi Maha Penyayang.

en.name: The Clans
en.source: Aplikasi Quran Kementrian Agama Republik Indonesia

text.1:
This verse commands Prophet Muhammad and the Muslims to be mindful of Allah by carrying out all His commands and ceasing all His prohibitions. Allah also forbids the Prophet (saw) and the Muslims from following the desires of the disbelievers who once suggested to him that he expel the weak and poor believers from his assembly. This verse also forbids the Prophet and the believers from following the hypocrites who outwardly claim to be believers, but whose hearts remain in disbelief, even constantly striving and cooperating with other disbelievers to destroy Islam and the Muslims.

Based on this verse and its *asbabun nuzul* (reasons for revelation), what is meant by "following the desires of the disbelievers and hypocrites" is "following their desires for the Muslims to acknowledge their beliefs and their gods, to believe that their gods can give intercession and benefit to those who worship them, and to acknowledge their laws as they acknowledge the laws revealed by Allah." Muslims should be wary of all efforts by disbelievers and hypocrites who deliberately obscure and corrupt their religion and beliefs, so that their understanding of the religion becomes distorted from the true understanding.

The end of this verse warns that Allah is All-Knowing of everything that is said, suggested, conveyed, and hidden in the hearts of the disbelievers, as well as everything they intend and desire. Therefore, He will determine a just punishment for them, and He is All-Wise in managing all the affairs of the Prophet and his companions.
text.2:
After Allah forbade the Muslims from fulfilling the desires of the disbelievers, He then commanded them to practice and implement all that He had revealed, namely the Al-Qur'an, by making it a guide in doing, acting, and determining attitudes in making choices. That which is in accordance with the guidance of the Al-Qur'an should be implemented, while that which is not in accordance should be immediately stopped and avoided. Thus, they will live happily, and the Islamic da'wah will succeed brilliantly. They will be spared from all possibilities according to the desires of the disbelievers and the possibility of misunderstanding the religion.

Then Allah warned that He knows everything that the Prophet and his companions do. Nothing is hidden from Him. Therefore, He will give recompense according to what He has promised, and will reveal to Muhammad saw everything he needs, everything that is beneficial in conveying the message and in building the Islamic community.
text.3: In this verse, Allah warns that if Muhammad has followed what has been revealed and not followed the desires of the disbelievers, then the Muslims should surrender themselves to Allah, entrust all their affairs to Him alone, and hold firmly to His religion with sincerity. He is sufficient as the protector of His servants. No one can prevent it if Allah wills to grant benefit and intercession to someone. Likewise, no one is able to protect if Allah wills to give trials and lessons in the form of harm and misery to someone.
text.4:
In this verse, Allah explains that He did not create two hearts in one body, so it is impossible for a person to have both faith and disbelief. If a person believes in Allah and His Messenger, then there will certainly be no disbelief or hypocrisy in his heart, even a little, and he will certainly follow the Qur'an and the Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, calling people to follow the path of Allah, follow His laws, and surrender only to Allah. Conversely, if a person is a disbeliever or a hypocrite, then there will certainly be no faith in Allah and His Messenger in his heart, and he will not put his trust in Allah. In other words, it is impossible for a person to have two opposing beliefs, just as it is impossible for there to be two hearts in one human body.

In the Jahiliyyah era, it often happened among the Arabs that, for a specific purpose and with specific words, they would make their wives like their mothers. So, if he said certain words to his wife, his wife would become like his mother, meaning he could not have relations with her.

According to the customs of the Arabs in the Jahiliyyah era, if a husband said to his wife, "Anti 'alayya kadhahri ummi" (your back is forbidden to me like the back of my mother), then from the moment the husband uttered those words, his wife was forbidden to him, just as it was forbidden for him to have relations with his mother. Such an act by a husband in the Jahiliyyah era was called "dhihar." In Islam, this law was replaced with the law explained in Surah al-Mujadalah/58 verse 3.

And those who divorce their wives by *dhihar* and then wish to retract what they said - then [there must be] the freeing of a slave before they touch one another. That is what you are admonished thereby; and Allah is Acquainted with what you do. (al-Mujadilah/58: 3)

Then, in this verse, Allah criticizes another custom of the Arabs in the Jahiliyyah era, because it included inventing something that was not true and had no strong basis, namely, adopting children. If a person adopted another person's child as his own in the Jahiliyyah era, then the laws that applied to his own biological children would apply to that child, such as inheritance, *mahram* relationships, and so on. This custom of the Jahiliyyah Arabs was once practiced by the Prophet Muhammad before this verse was revealed. He once adopted Zaid bin Harithah as his adopted son.

Zaid was the son of Harithah bin Sharahil and came from Bani Thayyi' in Syria. When a war broke out between one of the Arab tribes and Bani Thayyi', the young Zaid was captured and enslaved. Then Khalil from the Tihamah tribe bought Zaid and then sold him to Hakim bin Ham bin Khuwailid. Hakim gave Zaid as a gift to Khadijah, his father's sister. After the Prophet Muhammad married Khadijah, he was attracted to Zaid, so Khadijah gave Zaid as a gift to her husband.

Hearing the news that Zaid was with Muhammad, Harithah, Zaid's father, went with his brother to Mecca with the intention of redeeming his beloved son. He asked Muhammad to hand over Zaid. The Prophet Muhammad then gave Zaid the freedom to decide for himself, and he even refused to accept the ransom. After being asked, Zaid chose to stay with the Prophet Muhammad, refusing to go with his father to Syria. Harithah and his brother then said to Zaid, "Woe to you, Zaid, you prefer slavery to freedom." Zaid replied, "Indeed, I see goodness in this man (Muhammad), which makes me unable to part with him, and I am unable to choose anyone other than him forever."

The Prophet (saw) then went out to meet the people and said, "Bear witness, all of you, that Zaid is my son, I will inherit from him, and he will inherit from me..." Hearing this, Harithah and his brother were pleased, so Zaid was called "Zaid bin Muhammad" until this verse was revealed.

According to Qurthubi, all *tafsir* scholars agree that this verse was revealed in connection with Zaid bin Harithah.

Narrated by al-Bukhari, Muslim, at-Tirmidhi, an-Nasa'i, and other *hadith* imams from Ibn 'Umar that he said, "We never called him "Zaid bin Harithah," but we called him "Zaid bin Muhammad" until the revelation of this verse (al-Ahzab verse 5)." With the revelation of this verse, the Prophet (saw) said, "You are Zaid bin Harithah."

At the end of this verse, Allah reaffirms that the husband's statement that his wife is forbidden to him as his mother is forbidden to him, and the act of adopting a child and making his status the same as his own (biological) child is merely a statement of the tongue, without any basis in religion or sound reasoning. Therefore, such a statement will not have any legal consequences whatsoever. Allah says what is true, so it is impossible for a wife to be equated with a mother, just as it is impossible for another person to be judged the same as his own child. All children attribute (carry the father's name after their own name) themselves to their father and mother. It is impossible for someone to say that another person is the father of a child if he is not his descendant, just as it is impossible for a mother to say that she is the mother of a child when she has never given birth to him. Therefore, Allah says what is true and straight, so follow that word and follow the straight path that He has laid out.

With the revelation of this verse, the negative consequences experienced by wives due to their husbands' *dhihar* disappeared, and it became forbidden to adopt children and give them the same legal status as biological children. As for taking care of other people's children as a social act to be nurtured and educated with the permission of their own parents, without inheritance, without making them *mahram* as the status of biological children, and still attributed to their parents, then that is not forbidden, and even earns reward.
text.5:
This verse explains that Allah commands the Muslims to ascribe a child only to his father and mother, because the child originates from the loins of his father, then is conceived and born by his mother. Ascribing a child to his parents is a law of Allah that must be obeyed by all Muslims. Conversely, ascribing a child to someone other than his parents is not a law of Allah, but a law made up by humans themselves, so it is forbidden.

This opinion is agreed upon by most scholars who say, "Adopting a child so that the adopted child's status is the same as that of a biological child, such as having the right to inherit, establishing *mahram* relationships, and so on, is a major sin based on the hadith:

Narrated from Sa'ad bin Abi Waqqash r.a. that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said, "Whoever ascribes himself to someone other than his father or ascribes a slave to someone other than his master, then he deserves the curse of Allah, the angels, and all of mankind, Allah Ta'ala will not accept any expiation or ransom from him." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim)

Hadith of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), he said:

"There is no one who ascribes himself to someone other than his father, while he knows it, except that he has disbelieved." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Abu Dharr)

In another wording, also narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said:

"Whoever ascribes himself to someone other than his father, while he knows that that man is not his father, then Paradise is forbidden to him." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Sa'ad bin Abu Waqqash and Abu Bakrah)

Al-Alusi in *Tafsir Ruh al-Ma'ani* distinguishes between acknowledging and fostering a child. Adopting a child by someone and ascribing the child to him so that his status is the same as his own (biological) child, having inheritance rights, becoming *mahram* and a relative, is forbidden. As for if someone takes a child and treats him like his own child, but does not ascribe the child to him and does not declare that he has the same legal status as his own child, then Allah does not forbid it.

This verse explains that if a child's father is unknown, and he is cared for by another Muslim, then the relationship of care with the child is a relationship of religious brotherhood or a relationship of a master with his *maula* (a freed slave). Therefore, he must call the child "brother" or "*maula*". Others are also expected to call him that, for example, "Salim *maula* Huzaifah", because Salim, before the advent of Islam, was a slave of Huzaifah whose father was unknown.

Allah then closes this verse by stating that all sinful acts, such as ascribing a child to someone other than his father, that were committed before this verse was revealed, will be forgiven by Allah as long as they are stopped after its revelation. Allah is Most Forgiving, Most Merciful to His servants.
text.6:
This verse explains the position of the Prophet Muhammad among his people. It explains that even though believers prioritize themselves, the Prophet Muhammad paid more attention to, prioritized, and favored them. The Prophet always helped and assisted them, and always desired that they take the straight path that could lead them to eternal happiness. Therefore, the Prophet actually had more right over themselves. The Prophet's love for the Muslims exceeded his love for any of God's creatures. Thus, Muslims should follow all his commands.

The Prophet is the leader of the Muslims in worldly life and their guide to the path of Allah. If he invites the Muslims to fight in the way of Allah, they should immediately follow him, without waiting for permission from their parents. They should also always be willing to be his ransom, shield, and protector.

In another hadith, the Prophet's leadership over the Muslims is explained:

Indeed, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said, "There is no one among the believers to whom I am not the closest in this world and in the Hereafter. Recite the word of Allah, if you wish, "The Prophet is more worthy of the believers than themselves." So whoever among the believers (dies) and leaves behind wealth, then that wealth should be inherited by his 'ashabah (heirs). And whoever leaves behind debt or family, then let him come to me, for I am the one who will take care of his affairs." (Narrated by al-Bukhari from Abu Hurairah)

Based on the verse and hadith above, the scholars agree that after the Messenger of Allah passed away, the imam replaced his position. Therefore, the imam is obligated to pay the debts of poor people who die, as the Messenger of Allah did. The imam pays the debt by taking the funds from Baitul Mal or the State Treasury.

Because the Messenger of Allah is the father of the Muslims, his wives are also their mothers. This means occupying the position of a mother, in the obligation to honor and respect them, and it is forbidden to marry them. As for other matters, such as inheritance, the law of seeing their *aurat* or being in *khalwat* with them, the law is the same as other women who do not have a *mahram* relationship.

This principle does not contradict the word of Allah:

Muhammad is not the father of [any] one of your men, but [he is] the Messenger of Allah and last of the prophets. (al-Ahzab/33: 40)

Because what is meant is that the Prophet Muhammad is the father of all believers, not the adoptive father of someone.

Then this verse explains that kinship ties have more right to be the reason for obtaining inheritance than brotherhood, religious affiliation, or emigration. As is known, the Muslims in the early days of Islam in Medina inherited from each other through brotherhood established by the Prophet, not based on kinship ties. Therefore, a Muhajir obtained inheritance from an Ansar, even though they had no kinship ties. They inherited from each other solely because of the brotherhood that had been established by the Prophet.

The Prophet did this kind of relationship because the Muhajirin who had just moved from Mecca to Medina were poor, because they did not have time to bring their possessions from Mecca. Meanwhile, the Ansar, as the original inhabitants of Medina, should naturally help these poor Muhajirin. At that time, the main task of the Muslims was to strengthen the unity between the Muhajirin and the Ansar to face enemies who were always looking for opportunities to destroy them. Strengthening the relationship between the Muhajirin and the Ansar was one way to strengthen that unity. So the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) strengthened that relationship by making the Muhajirin and the Ansar brothers. He made that brotherhood the same as brotherhood based on kinship ties, so that the Muhajirin and the Ansar could inherit from each other. Therefore, the Prophet made Abu Bakr ash-Siddiq, a Muhajir, a brother to Kharijah bin Zaid, an Ansar. Likewise, Zubair was made a brother to Ka'ab bin Malik and Umar bin Khaththab to 'Utbah bin Malik al-Anshari, Abu 'Ubaidah to Sa'ad bin Mu'az, and others.

It was narrated by Hisyam bin 'Urwah from his father, from Zubair that he said, "Indeed, all of us Quraysh who came to Medina without wealth, and found the Ansar as the best friends, so we made a bond of brotherhood with them, and had the right to inherit from each other. So the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) made Abu Bakr a brother to Kharijah bin Zaid, and me to Ka'ab bin Malik."

After the Muslims became strong and the Muhajirin and the Ansar had a good life, then a verse was revealed that abolished the law of religious brotherhood and emigration as the basis for inheritance. Allah established kinship ties as the basis of inheritance law, while the relationship between Muslims was returned to its original position, namely a relationship of religious affiliation, belief, mutual help that does not lead to inheritance, as explained in His word:

The believers are but brothers. (al-hujurat/49: 10)

Hadith of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him):

None of you believes until he desires for his brother what he desires for himself. (Narrated by al-Bukhari, Muslim, Ahmad, and an-Nasa'i from Anas)

Furthermore, Allah explains that it is not a sin for a believer to do good to another believer, who has a relationship of affection, religious affiliation, and so on. That goodness is in the form of a will for them, because they no longer have the right to inherit with the revelation of this verse. The amount of this will has been determined by the hadith, which is no more than one-third of all the inheritance.

Establishing "ulu al-arham" (relatives) as the basis of inheritance law is a decision of Allah that is established in the Al-Qur'an. Therefore, that law may not be exchanged or replaced by anyone.
text.7:
This verse explains that Allah reminds Prophet Muhammad that He had received a covenant from Noah, Abraham, Moses, and Jesus that they would truly convey the religion of Allah to mankind. They would also mutually confirm each other in conveying that message, namely by acknowledging the prophets who preceded them as prophets of Allah.

This verse is in line with Allah's word:

"And [mention, O Muhammad], when Allah took the covenant of the prophets, [saying], "Whatever I give you of the Scripture and wisdom and then there comes to you a messenger confirming what is with you, you [must] believe in him and support him." [Allah] said, "Have you acknowledged and taken upon that My covenant?" They said, "We have acknowledged it." He said, "Then bear witness, and I am with you among the witnesses." (ali 'Imran/3: 81)

In this verse, only the prophets who are *ulul azmi* are mentioned, namely Noah, Abraham, Moses, Jesus, and Muhammad, because they are the ones who have *sharia* and holy books.

The covenant given by the prophets was a strong and weighty covenant that must be fulfilled. In the Hereafter, Allah will ask the prophets and their respective communities about the implementation of the tasks they had promised.

In another verse, Allah says:

Then We will surely question those to whom [a message] was sent, and We will surely question the messengers. (al-A'raf/7: 6)
text.8: This verse explains the reason why Allah took a strong covenant from the prophets to convey Allah's religion to humanity, and to help one another by telling their respective communities that they were all messengers of Allah. The reason is so that Allah can ask those prophets in the afterlife about the task given to them, whether they have carried it out well or not, and how their communities responded to that call. Likewise, so that Allah can ask the communities themselves in the afterlife about their attitude towards the call of the messengers. Thus, Allah prepares a painful punishment for those who deny the call of the messengers, just as He prepares a great reward for those who accept the call of the messengers.
text.9:
In this verse, Allah reminds the Muslims of the great favor He bestowed upon them during the Battle of the Trench (Ahzab) when they were tightly besieged by allied armies consisting of the army of the Quraysh, Bani Ghatafan, Bani an-Nadhir who had been expelled by the Messenger of Allah to Khaybar, and other armies that came to attack them in Medina. After a month of being besieged, Allah drove away their enemies with an army of angels and a very cold and strong hurricane on a very cold night, blowing away the tents of the army. At that time, fear and dread arose in the hearts of the enemies, so that one of their leaders named Thulaihah bin Khawailid al-Asadi said, "Muhammad has bewitched you, so save yourselves, save yourselves!" Thus, the Battle of the Trench was won by the Muslims without a battle, because the enemy had been driven away by an army of angels and a very strong cold hurricane.

At the end of this verse, Allah explains that He sees and knows everything that the Muslims did in the Battle of the Trench, such as digging trenches, arranging tactics, and war strategies to uphold His religion. Allah also knows all the suffering they experienced while besieged by the enemy, but they faced all that suffering with steadfastness and patience. All that the Muslims experienced will receive manifold rewards from Allah.
text.10:
This verse explains that Allah knew when the allied army came from below the valley, that is, from the east, consisting of the Gathafan group, the people of Nejed, and with them were also Bani Quraidhah and Bani an-Nadhir. Allah also knew the arrival of another allied group coming from above the valley from the west, consisting of the Quraysh and their followers from various tribes with Bani Kinanah and the people of Tihamah. In the situation where the enemy began to besiege, fear and trepidation arose, especially in the hearts of the hypocrites who were with the Muslims. Their eyes widened and their throats felt constricted due to fear, and doubts, hesitations, and various suspicions arose in their hearts. Some of them even suspected that the Muslims would be defeated by the allied army, considering their number was far greater compared to the number of Muslims.

As for the believers, they truly believed in Allah's promise that the Messenger of Allah (saw) and the Muslims would win the battle, and Allah's help would surely come, and they truly believed in His power and greatness. Meanwhile, the hypocrites suspected that the Muslims and the religion of Islam would be destroyed and perish. The polytheists of Mecca would conquer the city of Medina and return it to the state of Jahiliyyah.
text.11:
In such a gripping situation, Allah tested the strength of faith of the believers, so that it became clear who truly believed, who purified their obedience only to Allah, believed that Muhammad (peace be upon him) was the Messenger of Allah, and also believed in the victory of Islam and the Muslims, and who had wavering and fragile faith, who followed the Messenger of Allah only to seek personal gain. It was as if the Battle of the Trench was a selection process for the Muslims, to distinguish who were true friends and who were truly enemies.

(12) According to a narration, Thu'mah bin Ubairiq and seventy others said, "How can we be promised the conquest of the kingdoms of Persia and Rome, when at this time, none of us is even able to relieve ourselves?" They deliberately uttered this statement when they heard the news about the events that occurred when the Messenger of Allah was digging the trench and striking the rock that emitted light, as has been explained. So Allah revealed this verse.

In this verse, the result of Allah's test of the Muslims is explained, namely the outburst of the words of the hypocrites such as Mu'attib bin Qusyair and others who were still weak in faith, "All that Allah and His Messenger promised us, such as gaining victory, obtaining happiness in life, and so on, are nothing but deception and empty promises, and in fact, those promises bring misery and disaster to us all. Muhammad says that the kingdoms of Persia and Rome will be subjugated under the rule of the Muslims, but in reality, the Muslims who are supposed to conquer are now tightly besieged by allied armies and will experience destruction and annihilation."
text.12: In such a gripping situation, Allah tested the strength of faith of the believers, so that it became clear who truly believed, who purified their obedience only to Allah, believed that Muhammad (peace be upon him) was the Messenger of Allah, and also believed in the victory of Islam and the Muslims, and who had wavering and fragile faith, who followed the Messenger of Allah only to seek personal gain. It was as if the Battle of the Trench (Ahzab) was a selection process for the Muslims, to distinguish who were truly friends and who were truly enemies.
text.13:
Among them, like 'Abdullah bin Ubay and his companions, there were also those who said, "O people of Medina, this is not a place for us to stay, so return to your respective homes, so that you are not afflicted with calamity and misery and are not killed by the enemies who are besieging us."

Some commentators interpret, "O people of Medina, there is no place for you all to continue adhering to the religion of Muhammad. Return to your former religion, and hand over Muhammad and his followers to his enemies who are besieging us, so that the safety of all of you is guaranteed."

Because of the words and invitations of the hypocritical and Jewish leaders, some of them were influenced and asked the Prophet (saw) to be allowed to leave the battlefield and return to their homes. Among those who asked were the Bani Harisah. The reason they gave was that their houses were located close to the enemy's bases and their walls were not strong, they feared the enemy would seize their property.

At the end of this verse, Allah explains that all the reasons put forward by the hypocrites and Jews were fabricated reasons. They put forward these reasons solely to avoid participating in the war with the Prophet and the Muslims, because they did not see any benefit they would gain.
text.14:
This verse explains the weakness of heart and conviction of the hypocrites and Jews who were undergoing trials from Allah. They were unable to overcome the difficulties they were facing, and unable to confront the dangers and threats that came to them, so they asked the Messenger of Allah (saw) to be allowed to leave the battlefield.

The state of their hearts and convictions is described by Allah as follows: "If the allied forces had entered the homes of the hypocrites and Jews from all directions, destroying and plundering what was inside, persecuting and killing their children and families, asking them to return to embracing polytheism, creating chaos and attacking the Muslims from behind, they would surely allow the enemy's actions and follow everything they wanted. This was caused by fear and the absence of ideals in their hearts, except to seek worldly pleasures and personal gain alone."

From this verse, it is understood that fear is the cause, so that the hypocrites and Jews have no stance. That fear arises in their hearts because there is not even a little faith. Whereas if they thought correctly and weighed the pros and cons, they would be safer if they participated in the war.
text.15:
This verse explains that those who asked permission to leave the battlefield had previously promised the Messenger of Allah (saw) that they would not betray him and would fight alongside the Muslims against the polytheists. However, in the end, they broke their promise.

According to a narration, the Bani Harisah once fled the battlefield of Uhud, then they asked the Prophet to forgive their mistake. They promised not to flee from the battlefield again and would fight with the Prophet and the Muslims.

At the end of this verse, Allah affirms that those who have made promises will be held accountable for what they have said. On the Day of Judgment, they will be given retribution commensurate with their actions.
text.16:
In this verse, Allah commands the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) to convey to those who avoid and flee from the battlefield that their actions will be of no benefit whatsoever. They will not be able to avoid the death that Allah has decreed, nor can they evade the killing that Allah has ordained for someone, which will be carried out by their enemies. All of that has been decreed by Allah, and no one can change it.

Even if someone can flee from battle and it benefits them, and they can avoid their own death, then that is only temporary. Life in this world is a fleeting life, even if it feels long, it is in reality very short when compared to the eternal life of the Hereafter.
text.17:
According to another narration, it was the Jews who were inviting. They invited the hypocrites to distance themselves from the Prophet and the Muslims, saying, "If Abu Sufyan wins, Muhammad and his followers will surely be destroyed." Therefore, this verse was revealed.

In this verse, Allah commands Prophet Muhammad to answer the words of those who said that they would be safe if they left the battlefield. Allah says, "None of you can avoid being killed or suffering misery if Allah has decreed it. Likewise, no one can bring any good to anyone if Allah does not will it. Benefit and hardship are only determined by Allah, and no one can replace or change them. Therefore, the hypocrites and Jews who betrayed the Prophet will not find anyone who can help and avert the disaster that will befall them."

According to a narration, 'Abdullah bin Ubay and his companions, the hypocrites and Jews, said to the Muslims, "Muhammad and his followers are very few compared to the number of the Quraysh and their allies. Therefore, they will surely perish, and let us distance ourselves from him."
text.18:
This verse explains that Allah truly knows those who hinder people from following the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to fight in His way. He also knows those who are reluctant and ask permission from the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) not to participate in the battle, as well as those who invite the people of Medina not to join him in battle.

Meanwhile, there are also those who participate in the battle for only a short time, merely to show the Muslims that they are actually among those who are participating in the battle. However, when the Muslims are off guard, they disappear quietly and return to their respective homes.
text.19:
In this verse, Allah mentions the characteristics of those who consistently avoid participating in battles alongside the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him):

1. They do not assist Muhammad and the Muslims in facing the enemy, neither with material possessions nor with their lives.

2. When the enemies have attacked and the believers have fought bravely to repel the enemy's attack, they look to the left and to the right out of fear, seeking a way and an opportunity to flee the battlefield and avoid death.

3. When the battle is over and they feel safe, they act arrogantly and boast about their services and bravery on the battlefield, even though all of that is nothing but hurtful nonsense. It is as if they were the ones who fought fiercely until victory was achieved, even though everything they say is pure lies.

4. They are very greedy for the spoils of war that the Muslims have obtained, and they do not want to relinquish anything they have acquired. Yet, previously, they were unwilling to spend their wealth to help the Prophet (peace be upon him).

Those who possess the characteristics mentioned above are, in essence, people who do not believe in Allah and His Messenger, do not act with sincere devotion, and are unwilling to sacrifice even a little, because they are hypocrites (munafik). Because of their nature and attitude, Allah erases all the reward for their deeds and makes them like scattered dust, which has no meaning whatsoever. Erasing the reward for the deeds of the hypocrites is not difficult for Allah, but very easy for Him, because He is All-Powerful and All-Knowing of everything.
text.20:
Because of their extreme fear, the hypocrites thought that the allied forces were still on the battlefield, even though those soldiers had scattered and returned to their respective countries. This shows that the hypocrites are cowardly and faithless people who did not participate in the war, as if they were not even present there. Therefore, they were unaware of the enemy's movements. Meanwhile, if the allied forces were to return to attack, they would wish to be in the Badiyah (desert) far from the city with the Bedouin Arabs and desert dwellers, so that they would not be exposed to the dangers of war. For them, it would be enough to ask people who came to their place about the condition of the Prophet and the Muslims.

Furthermore, Allah explains that in the past battle, if the hypocrites had not left the battlefield and remained with the Muslims on the front lines, and then a fierce battle occurred, they also would not have participated in the war. Even if they did participate, they would fight without sincerity and faith. They would fight the enemy only to fulfill the Prophet's request.
text.21: In this verse, Allah warns the hypocrites that they can actually obtain a good example from the Prophet Muhammad (saw). The Messenger of Allah (saw) was a person of strong faith, brave, patient, and steadfast in facing all kinds of trials, completely believing in all of Allah's decrees, and possessing noble character. If they aspired to be good people, happy in this life and the hereafter, surely they would emulate and follow him. However, their actions and behavior show that they do not expect Allah's pleasure and all forms of true happiness.
text.22:
In this verse, Allah explains the attitude and actions of the Muslims in facing the Battle of the Trench (Ahzab). They worked and struggled solely for Allah and followed the Prophet's commands, not for their own self-interest. They surrendered all their wealth, even their lives, to the Prophet for the sake of the struggle. They fought with steadfastness and patience. The greater the danger that threatened, the stronger their faith and perseverance became. When they saw the allied army, which was very large and about to attack them, while their numbers were few, they said, "This is what Allah and His Messenger promised us, in the form of trials and tribulations, as a prelude to the victory that will come. Therefore, we must be steadfast and patient in facing it."

In another verse, the conditions for happiness and victory that believers will obtain are explained. Allah says:

*Or do you think that you will enter Paradise while such [trial] has not yet come to you as came to those who passed on before you? They were touched by poverty and hardship and were shaken until [even] the Messenger and those who believed with him said, "When is the help of Allah?" Unquestionably, the help of Allah is near.* (al-Baqarah/2: 214)

And His saying again:

*Do the people think that they will be left to say, "We believe" and they will not be tried?* (al-'Ankabut/29: 2)

It is narrated by Ibn Kathir that while digging the trench before the allied army arrived, the Messenger of Allah (saw) once conveyed that Jibril told him that the kingdoms of Persia and Rome would be conquered under the rule of the Muslims. Hearing this news, the Muslims were very happy because they believed that it was Allah's promise.

When the allied army came to besiege, they considered the arrival of the allied army as a test and trial for them before achieving victory and before they conquered Persia and Rome, so they said, "What Allah promised is true, by expanding the Islamic religion to all corners of the world in the future, and what Allah indicated to achieve victory and happiness is also true, namely, to trust in Allah (tawakkal) and be patient in accepting trials and obstacles."
text.23:
In a hadith narrated by Ahmad, Muslim, at-Tirmidhi, an-Nasa'i, and other hadith imams from the companion Anas, he said, "My uncle Anas bin an-Nadhar, did not participate in the Battle of Badr, so he felt sad and disappointed. He said, 'I was not present at the first battle that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) participated in. Indeed, if Allah gives me the opportunity to participate in a battle with the Messenger of Allah after this, Allah Ta'ala will surely see what I will do.' So my uncle was able to participate in the Battle of Uhud. On the way to Uhud, my uncle met Sa'ad bin Mu'adh, and Sa'ad asked him, 'O Abu 'Amr, where are you going?' My uncle replied, 'Seeking the scent of Paradise that I will obtain in the Battle of Uhud later.' So my uncle continued to Uhud and fell as a martyr there. On his body there were approximately 80 marks of blows, spear thrusts, and arrow holes." Then this verse was revealed.

Allah explains that among the Muslims who truly believe in Allah and His Messenger, there are people who fulfill their promises. They have struggled with all their soul and wealth, among them are those who died as martyrs in the Battle of Badr, the Battle of Uhud, the Battle of Khandaq, and other battles, while some others are waiting, hoping for a longer life, waiting for the decree of Allah the One and Only. These people who are still alive will never change their promise to Allah, they will continue to fulfill their promise as long as they live.

In Tafsir al-Kasysyaf, it is explained that some of the companions made a vow: if they participated in a battle with the Messenger of Allah, they would not retreat and would remain steadfast until they fell as martyrs. Among the companions who made that promise were Usman bin Affan, Thalhah bin 'Ubaidillah, Sa'id bin Zaid, Hamzah, Mush'ab bin 'Umair, and other companions.
text.24:
In this verse, Allah explains that the reason for trials and tribulations for believers is to distinguish the bad from the good, those who truly believe from those who disbelieve. This trial also aims to reveal and manifest what is actually in their hearts. In this regard, Allah says:

"And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of Allah] and the patient, and We will test your affairs." (Muhammad/47: 31)

And the word of Allah:

"Allah would not leave the believers in the state you are now until He distinguishes the evil from the good." (ali 'Imran/3: 179)

Then, after their condition becomes clear, Allah gives rewards to those who truly fulfill their promises and punishes the hypocrites who do not fulfill their promises. Even so, the door of repentance is still open to those hypocrites, that is, if they believe, fulfill their promises, and do good deeds. Allah will forgive the sins they have committed in the past.

At the end of this verse, Allah affirms to His servants that He is the Most Forgiving, the Most Merciful, erasing all the sins of those who truly repent, as if the sin had never been committed. From this verse, it is understood that the door of repentance is always open to every servant who does it. Therefore, Muslims should always do it.
text.25:
In this verse, Allah once again explains the great favor He bestowed upon the Muslims during the Battle of the Trench (Ahzab), so that they were saved from the danger of destruction. That favor was that Allah sent them reinforcements in the form of a very cold, strong wind and an invisible army of angels. As a result, those who disbelieved in Allah and His Messenger, namely the Quraysh and their followers, the Ghatafan and their followers, the Jewish groups, and the hypocrites, did not obtain what they wanted; instead, they fled helter-skelter seeking their own safety, returning to their respective homelands.

Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said:

"There is no god but Allah alone. He fulfilled His promise, helped His servant, gave victory to His army, and defeated the confederate forces alone, so there is nothing after Him."

In another hadith, al-Bukhari and Muslim from 'Abdullah bin Abu Aufa, he said, "The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) prayed to Allah:

"O Allah, Revealer of the Qur'an, Swift in reckoning, defeat the confederate forces. O Allah, defeat them and shake them."

According to the narration of Muhammad bin Ishaq, when the confederate forces had fled and left the trench, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said:

"The Quraysh will never fight you after this year, but you will fight them."

The words of the Messenger of Allah were proven later. After the Battle of the Trench, the polytheists never again fought the Muslims, but the Prophet and the Muslims fought them, until Mecca was conquered. Therefore, it can be said that the Battle of the Trench was the peak of the difficulties faced by the Prophet and the Muslims in facing the polytheists in spreading the religion of Islam. Although difficulties still existed, they were insignificant compared to the previous difficulties.

At the end of this verse, it is affirmed that Allah is All-Strong and All-Mighty, unmatched by anything. Therefore, He easily drove away the confederate army, which was large in number.
text.26:
This verse explains the war against the Bani Quraidhah, one of the Jewish tribes of Medina who had made a peace treaty with the Prophet. As explained earlier, when the Muslims were in a critical situation facing the allied armies in the Battle of the Trench (Ahzab), the Jews of Bani Quraidhah, who were citizens of Medina, betrayed the Muslims from within. Their leader, Ka'ab bin Asad, was incited by the leader of Bani an-Nadhir, Huyai bin Akhthab, to cancel the peace treaty they had made with the Prophet and join the allied army that was besieging the city of Medina. This invitation was initially rejected by Ka'ab bin Asad, but he eventually accepted it. Thus, they betrayed the Prophet and joined the Ahzab group.

The news of the Bani Quraidhah's betrayal shocked the Muslims, because it happened within the city of Medina. Therefore, the Messenger of Allah (saw) immediately sent two of his companions, namely Sa'ad bin Mu'adz, the head of the Aus tribe, and Sa'ad bin Ubadah, the head of the Khazraj tribe, to the Bani Quraidhah to advise them not to continue the betrayal. Upon arriving at the Bani Quraidhah's location, the two messengers immediately conveyed the Prophet's (saw) messages. However, they rejected the Prophet's request with a rude attitude full of arrogance and pride, and they continued the betrayal.

After Allah drove away the allied forces, He revealed to the Prophet Muhammad that the Muslims should immediately crush the treacherous Bani Quraidhah. Therefore, the Prophet and the Muslims immediately settled accounts with the traitors. The Prophet and the Muslims immediately went to their village to besiege it. Upon hearing of the arrival of the Prophet and the Muslims, they immediately entered the fortresses to defend themselves. The Muslim army at that time was led by Ali bin Abi Talib. After being besieged in the fortresses for twenty-five days in fear, they were willing to surrender to the Prophet on the condition that Sa'ad bin Mu'adz, the head of the Aus tribe, would be the judge of their actions. The surrender and the condition were accepted by the Prophet, so they came down from the fortresses and surrendered to him. After careful consideration, Sa'ad sentenced them to death, their men were killed, while the women and children were taken captive.

Such a punishment is appropriate for traitors of a country that is at war, especially when the betrayal is carried out when the enemy is launching an attack. The Islamic community in Medina at that time was a newly growing community, a community that was just beginning to implement laws based on Islamic stipulations that were different from the old laws. Therefore, it is appropriate that the punishment given to the treacherous Bani Quraidhah during the war was the law of war. With this punishment, the city of Medina remained strong and the Prophet remained authoritative, and the other residents of Medina knew and realized that every act of betrayal would be subject to a commensurate punishment.
text.27:
This verse explains that the property of the Bani Quraidhah, who were sentenced to death, was given by Allah to the Muslims, including all the gardens, houses, and livestock they possessed. Furthermore, in this verse, Allah promises the Muslims that He will bequeath other lands, which at that time had not yet been entered by the Islamic army, but which they would surely enter and conquer.

At the end of this verse, Allah explains that He has the power to give everything to the Muslims to help them in carrying out His religion and to expand Islam itself. This is a provision that will certainly be fulfilled.
text.28:
Allah commanded the Messenger of Allah (saw) to convey to his wives that they should choose what they desired from two options. The first option was that if they desired the life of this world with all its pleasures, then the Prophet did not possess such things, and he had nothing to give to fulfill that desire. Therefore, the Prophet would divorce them and give them *mut'ah* (provision), as prescribed by the religion. He would also divorce them in a good manner.

According to Allah's decree, a husband who divorces his wife should give *mut'ah* in the form of clothing, money, or jewelry voluntarily to the divorced wife, according to his ability; the rich according to his wealth and the poor according to his poverty. Allah says:

"And provide for them, the rich according to his means and the poor according to his means, a provision according to what is acceptable. This is a duty upon the doers of good." (al-Baqarah/2: 236)

Allah also decreed that if a husband divorces his wife, then he should release them in a good manner and divorce them during their period of purity before intercourse, so that they can observe the *idah* (waiting period) in a short time. Allah says:

"O Prophet, when you [men] divorce women, divorce them for [the commencement of] their waiting period and keep count of the waiting period, and fear Allah, your Lord." (ath-Thalaq/65:1)

At the time this verse was revealed, the Messenger of Allah had nine wives, namely 'Aisyah bint Abu Bakar, Hafshah bint 'Umar, Ummu Salamah, Ummu Habibah Ramlah bint Sufyan, Saudah bint Zam'ah, Zainab bint Jahsy, Maimunah bint Hars, Safiyyah bint Huyai bin Akhthab, and Juwairiyah bint al-Haris. Of these nine wives, five were from the tribe of Quraysh and four were not from the tribe of Quraysh.

Allah says:

"Perhaps his Lord will give him, if he divorces you, in exchange wives better than you - submitting [to Allah], believing, devoutly obedient, repentant, worshipping, and traveling - [ones previously] married and virgins." (at-Tahrim/66: 5)
text.29: The second option conveyed by the Messenger of Allah was that if his wives chose the pleasure of Allah and His Messenger and the reward of the Hereafter, then they should obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah has prepared a great reward for his wives who are good in speech, deeds, and behavior. They will be placed in Paradise full of delights.
text.30:
In this verse, Allah warns the wives of the Prophet to always guard themselves because they are the mothers of all Muslims and serve as role models for them. Allah's command is, "Whoever among the wives of the Prophet commits a manifest indecency, a forbidden act, and so on, then they will receive double the punishment received by ordinary people."

The imposition of double punishment on the wives of the Prophet is because they are among those who truly know Allah's commands and prohibitions. In addition, they are also the guardians of the Prophet's household from any evil deeds that might occur within it.

Some scholars establish a ruling based on this verse that for the same type of criminal act, the punishment received by those who know is heavier than the punishment received by those who do not know. A person who knows is aware of the consequences of an action. If he commits that act, it means he does so with full awareness, while the one who does not know commits the criminal act without true awareness. Therefore, those who know are obligated to receive double the punishment received by those who do not know.

It is narrated that a man said to Zainal 'Abidin r.a., "Indeed, you are the family of the Prophet who have obtained forgiveness." Then Zainal 'Abidin became angry with the man and said, "What Allah has decreed for the wives of the Prophet is more fitting to be decreed for us than what you have said. We believe that the reward for our good deeds is multiplied, just as the recompense for our mistakes is also multiplied." Then he recited this verse.
text.31: In this verse, Allah explains that whoever among the wives of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) remains obedient to Allah and His Messenger, and performs righteous deeds, will surely be given a double reward as an appreciation for them. This appreciation is due to their position as "Ummahatul Mu'minin," meaning the mothers of honor of all believers, and they reside in the house of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), the place where Allah's revelation descends, the light of wisdom and guidance to the straight path. In addition to the multiplied reward, Allah will also grant them a noble provision in this world and in the Hereafter. In this world, because they are the center of attention for all believing women who view them with full respect and dignity, and in the Hereafter, because they are the wives of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) who will be placed by Allah in a high degree in the Garden of Bliss (Jannatun Na'im).
text.32:
In this verse, Allah warns the wives of the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) that they, with the title "Ummahatul Mu'minin" (Mothers of the Believers), cannot be equated with any believing women in terms of virtue and respect, if they truly fear Allah. No woman can resemble their position, let alone exceed their virtue, because their husband is "Sayyidul Anbiya' wal Mursalin" (the Master of the Prophets and Messengers). Therefore, if they are having conversations with others, they are forbidden from lowering their voices in a way that could create unfavorable feelings towards their purity and honor, especially if they are dealing with wicked or hypocritical people whose good intentions are doubtful. The wives of the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him), after his death, may not be married by anyone, in accordance with Allah's statement:

"And it is not [right] for you to harm the Messenger of Allah or ever to marry his wives after him. Indeed, that would be in the sight of Allah an enormity." (al-Ahzab/33: 53)
text.33:
In this verse, Allah commands the wives of the Prophet to remain in their respective homes and not to go out except when necessary. This command applies to the wives of the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him). They are forbidden from displaying their adornments and behaving like the people of Jahiliyyah in the past before the time of Prophet Muhammad.

After they are forbidden from doing evil, they are commanded to do good, such as establishing the five daily prayers according to their conditions and pillars, and paying zakat on their wealth. It has become customary that when prayer is mentioned, it is always associated with zakat, because both result in the purification of oneself and one's wealth. The wisdom behind both is to remain obedient to Allah and His Messenger because it is the implementation of the content of the two statements of the *shahada*, which is the path to happiness in this world and the hereafter.

Allah issues this command accompanied by the term "Ahlul Bait," which means all the family members of the Prophet's household, with the intention of removing sins from them. Allah also intends to cleanse them from the filth of wickedness and hypocrisy that usually clings to sinners. Thus, Allah will cleanse them completely.

Anas bin Malik, in order to explain who is meant by *Ahlul Bait* in this verse, narrates:

Indeed, the Messenger of Allah used to visit the house of his daughter Fatimah for six months at every Fajr prayer. He would call out, "Prayer, O Ahlul Bait, indeed Allah intends to remove impurity from you and purify you with a thorough purification." (Narrated by at-Tirmidhi and Abu Dawud ath-thayalisi from Anas bin Malik)
text.34: In this verse, Allah explains the reasons why they received that great favor. Among them is because the residences of the Prophet's wives were places where revelation descended. Allah commanded the Prophet's wives to teach others what was recited in their homes from the verses of Allah and the Sunnah of the Prophet. The Sunnah of the Prophet could be in the form of what they witnessed about the Prophet's life within the household and in relation to Islamic law.
text.35:
In this verse, Allah explains the characteristics of His servants who will have all their sins and mistakes forgiven and be admitted into Paradise. Their characteristics are of ten kinds:

1.  Obedient and submissive to Islamic law, both in words and deeds.

2.  Affirming and believing in the teachings of Allah and His Messenger.

3.  Always performing religious commands with full devotion and tranquility.

4.  Always truthful in words and deeds, as a sign of perfect faith. In a sahih hadith, it is mentioned that the Messenger of Allah (saw) said, "Hold fast to truthfulness, for truthfulness leads to righteousness, and righteousness leads to Paradise. And beware of falsehood, for falsehood leads to wickedness, and wickedness leads to Hell."

5.  Patient in facing difficulties and suffering in carrying out Allah's commands, and restraining desires and lusts.

6.  Humble and submissive to Allah, both physically and spiritually, in carrying out all tasks and obligations, and with sincerity solely to seek Allah's pleasure.

7.  Giving charity with wealth and providing assistance to those who are in need and have no income.

8.  Fasting, which can help subdue desires and lusts, as stated in the words of the Messenger of Allah (saw): "O young men, whoever among you can afford to marry, let him marry, for marriage is more effective in lowering the gaze and guarding chastity. And whoever cannot afford it, let him fast, for fasting is a shield for him." (Narrated by al-Bukhari and Muslim from Ibn Mas'ud)

9.  Guarding their private parts and honor from all forbidden and vile acts, in accordance with Allah's saying:

   "And those who guard their private parts, Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they will not be blamed. But whoever seeks beyond that - then those are the transgressors." (al-Mu'minun/23: 5-7)

10. Always remembering Allah with the tongue and heart, in accordance with the hadith narrated from Mujahid, which states that a person is not considered to remember Allah much unless he can remember Him while standing, sitting, and lying down. Abu Sa'id al-Khudri narrated a hadith that the Messenger of Allah (saw) said:

    "If a husband wakes up his wife at night and they pray Tahajud two rak'ahs, then they are both among those who remember Allah much on that night." (Narrated by Abu Dawud, an-Nasa'i, and Ibn Majah)

In another hadith from Sahl bin Mu'az al-Juhani, from his father, it is narrated that a man asked the Messenger of Allah (saw):

"Which of the fighters has the greatest reward, O Messenger of Allah?" The Prophet (saw) replied, "The one who remembers Allah the most." Then he asked again, "Which of the fasting people has the greatest reward?" The Prophet (saw) replied, "The one who remembers Allah the most." Then he mentioned the one who prays, gives zakat, performs Hajj, and gives charity, and in all of these, the Prophet (saw) said, "Those who remember Allah the most." Abu Bakr then said to Umar, "The one who remembers Allah much has taken all the good." And the Prophet (saw) added, "Indeed, that is so." (Narrated by Ahmad)
text.36:
In this verse, Allah explains that it is not fitting for believers, both men and women, that when Allah and His Messenger have decreed a matter, they should choose another decree that contradicts the decree of both. Determining one's own choice that is not in accordance with the decrees of Allah and His Messenger means disobeying their commands and straying from the right path. Such a thing is also threatened by Allah in His saying:

"So let those beware who dissent from the Messenger's order, lest fitnah strike them or a painful punishment." (an-Nur/24: 63)
text.37:
Furthermore, in this verse, Allah warns His Prophet that what happened between Zaid bin Harithah and Zainab binti Jahsy was to strengthen his faith by affirming the truth and removing doubts from the hearts of those with weak faith. Allah commanded His Messenger to pay attention to his words when he said to Zaid bin Harithah, "Keep your wife and fear Allah," and do not separate from her because of arrogance or pride due to lineage, because divorce would result in a stain that is difficult to erase.

The Prophet himself already knew that Zaid would eventually divorce Zainab. He felt burdened if this became a reality, because it would cause various responses among the community. The Prophet concealed in his heart what Allah had revealed, because the Prophet himself realized that he should be an example for all his people to carry out Allah's commands, even at the expense of his feelings. According to instinct, humans are usually afraid of other humans, even though Allah is more worthy of being feared. He imagined that if he married Zainab, the ex-wife of his adopted son, it would surely become a topic of conversation among the Arabs, because since the Jahiliyyah era they considered an adopted son to be the same as a biological son, so they forbade marrying the ex-wife of an adopted son.
text.38:
In this verse, Allah strengthens the law that has been previously established, which is that there is no objection whatsoever upon the Prophet (saw) regarding what Allah has decreed for him, namely to marry the former wife of his adopted son after she had been divorced by her husband and her waiting period ('iddah) had ended. The Jews often criticized the Prophet Muhammad (saw) for having many wives, even though they knew that previous prophets had even more wives, such as Prophet David and Prophet Solomon.

The Prophet Muhammad was commanded by Allah not to heed the talk of the general public regarding his marriage to Zainab. When Zaid had divorced his wife, Allah married the Prophet (saw) to Zainab so that there would be no objection for the believers to marry the former wife of an adopted son after she had been divorced. Allah's decree regarding the marriage of Zainab to the Prophet was a certain decree.

It is narrated by al-Bukhari and at-Tirmidhi that Zainab often boasted about herself in front of the other wives of the Prophet, saying, "You were married off by your own families, but I was married off by Allah." It is narrated by Ibn Jarir ath-Thabari from Sya'bi that Zainab once said to the Prophet, "I have an advantage in three matters that your other wives do not possess, namely: my grandfather and your grandfather are the same, namely Abdul Muththalib; Allah married you to me by the command of revelation from the heavens; and the one assigned to deliver it was the Angel Gabriel."
text.39: In this verse, Allah explains that the messengers who preceded Prophet Muhammad had implemented *sunnatullah* (Allah's way/law). They were people full of piety and sincerity in worship. They were also people who conveyed the *syariat* (laws) of Allah, greatly feared Him, and did not fear anyone besides Him. Prophet Muhammad was also commanded to make them an example in implementing *sunnatullah*, and Allah is sufficient as the Reckoner.
text.40:
When the Messenger of Allah married Zainab, many hypocrites criticized the marriage because it was seen as marrying the ex-wife of one's own son. So Allah revealed this verse stating that the Prophet Muhammad saw need not worry about the mockery of those who said that he married the ex-wife of his son, because Zaid was not his biological son, but only an adopted son. Muhammad saw is not the father of any man among you, but he is the Messenger of Allah and His last prophet. There will be no prophet after him.

The Prophet Muhammad saw is the father of the Muslims in terms of honor and affection, just as every messenger is the father of his entire ummah. Muhammad is not the father of any man from his ummah in the sense of "father" in terms of lineage that causes the prohibition of *mushaharah* (affinity), but he is the father of all believers in terms of religion.
